resources.string:
1. Single wave:
wave over the proximity sensor (generally located near the front camera) to tell me what to do by selecting one of the functions from the list. Note that you can use anything to wave. A book will also work. You can also flip the phone down and the chosen function will be performed. Same will happen if you put phone on ear (useful during answer call)


2. Double wave:
wave over the proximity sensor two times consecutively with a time interval of less then 1.2 (by default) seconds to perform the selected function.


3. Silent on pick up:
the phone will automatically silent when you pick it up from a flat surface. This will be ignored if the phone is already moving.


4. Automatic speaker toggle:
The speaker phone will automatically turn on if the device is moved away from the ear. It will turn off if device is again brought back to the ear. It will only work after putting phone on ear at least once which, is to protect privacy.
 Note:
This does not work if headset is connected or audio is routed by bluetooth. So, I've got you covered!


5. Phone kept facing down:
You can end call or mute microphone during a call by putting phone on a flat surface facing down.


Blacklist- You can blacklist contacts for which you do not want automatic speaker toggle to work. Thus, prevent embarrassing situations with sensitive contacts!


Consecutive wave threshold- The time gap between two consecutive waves so that they are counted as double wave.

Start scheduling calls by tapping the plus symbol at the bottom left corner. In the new page that opens:
 1. Select the contact you want to call.
 2. Select the time at which you want the call to take place.
 3. Select the date at which you want the call to take place.
 4. You can also select call daily checkbox and skip mentioning the date in previous step.
 5. Select the mobile number of the contact from the drop down list on which you want to call.
 6. Uncheck the box for 'vibrate before calling' if you don't want the phone to vibrate before placing the call.
 7. Uncheck the box for 'call out name before calling' if you don't want the phone to call out the contact name before placing the call.
 Note:- Select the default SIM on your phone before the time you want the call to take place.

 You can edit a currently scheduled call by tapping on the schedule in the list. You can also delete the scheduled call by swiping from the right edge towards left.
